TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Transform3D extends System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3D

Docs.summary: Provides a parent class for all three-dimensional transformations, including translation, rotation, and scale transformations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixTransform3D> class to create transformations not available from the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.RotateTransform3D>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.TranslateTransform3D>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ScaleTransform3D> classes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Transform3D Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this , making deep copies of this object's values.
Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property is even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property is

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Transform3D CloneCurrentValue() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property is even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
## Remarks The identity transformation has the effect of multiplying the object by the identity matrix.

Docs.summary: Gets the inverse transformation of this object, if possible.
Docs.value: An inverse of this instance, if possible; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Inverse is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the matrix is affine.
Docs.value: if the matrix is affine; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks An affine transformation preserves collinearity.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D TransformBounds(valuetype System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D rect) cil managed

Docs.summary: Transforms the specified 3-D bounding box and returns an axis-aligned 3-D bounding box that is exactly large enough to contain it.
Docs.returns: The smallest axis-aligned 3-D bounding box possible that contains the transformed .

remarks.format: ## Remarks TransformBounds is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool TryTransform (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D inPoint, out System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D result);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool TryTransform(valuetype System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D inPoint, valuetype System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D result) cil managed

Docs.summary: Attempts to transform the specified 3-D point and returns a value that indicates whether the transformation was successful.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Unlike the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3D.Transform%2A> method, this method does not throw an exception if the transformation is unsuccessful.
TryTransform is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the that represents the value of the current transformation.
Docs.value: Matrix3D that represents the value of the current transformation.
